Replace.Text: +20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Medieval, Renaissance, and Industrial era wonders. [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from wonders of any era is +50%.
A building unique to America. +50% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism pressure from this city towards other civilizations in the Modern era.

Khmer unique Classical Era Siege unit that replaces the Catapult and is stronger than the Catapult, both offensively and defensively. Domreys can shoot in the same turn that they move and also exert zone of control.

Happy cities receive an +10% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, while Ecstatic cities recieve an additional +5%, for a total of +15%. Happy cities generate +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point per Campus and +1 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer point per Industrial Zone. Ecstatic cities double those Great Person Point amounts.
+{1_Value} when attacking

A district unique to Rome that replaces the Aqueduct district and is cheaper to build. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every 2 adjacent districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. If built adjacent to a Geothermal Fissure +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. In all cases the Bath provides an additional bonus of +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought. Must be built adjacent to the City Center.

A district unique to Rome that replaces the Aqueduct district and is cheaper to build. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every 2 adjacent districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. If built adjacent to a Geothermal Fissure +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. In all cases the Bath provides an additional bonus of +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought. Must be built adjacent to the City Center.

A district unique to Rome that replaces the Aqueduct district and is cheaper to build. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every 2 adjacent districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. In all cases the Bath provides an additional bonus of +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. Must be built adjacent to the City Center.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Sphinx, unique to Egypt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +2 Appeal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if next to a wonder. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production if built on Desert or +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if built on Floodplains.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture once Diplomatic Service is discovered. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight. Cannot be built next to another Sphinx or on Snow or Snow Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Sphinx, unique to Egypt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +1 Appeal. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if next to a wonder. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production if built on Desert or +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if built on Floodplains.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture once Diplomatic Service is discovered. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight. Cannot be built next to another Sphinx or on Snow or Snow Hills.
+20% [ICON_Food] Growth in the city. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Magnus' city provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to their starting city.
+4 [ICON_Production] Production and +4 [ICON_Food] Food from domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.
+4 [ICON_FAITH] Faith from Geothermal Fissures and Volcanic Soil.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Pairidaeza, unique to Persia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +2 Appeal. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each adjacent Holy Site, Campus, and Theater Square. +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each adjacent Commercial Hub, Harbor, Industrial Zone, and City Center. Additional [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism as you advance through the Technology and Civics Tree. Cannot be built on Snow, Tundra, Snow Hills, or Tundra Hills or adjacent to another Pairidaeza.

All units get +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking. +5 Loyalty per turn in occupied cities with a garrisoned unit. Declaring a Surprise War counts as a Formal War for the purposes of [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] Grievances and warmongering.

All units get +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking. +5 Loyalty per turn in occupied cities with a garrisoned unit. Declaring a Surprise War counts as a Formal War for the purpose of warmongering and war weariness.

All units get +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking. No penalties to yields in occupied cities. Declaring a Surprise War only counts as a Formal War for the purpose of warmongering and war weariness.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity with Political Philosophy civic. Receive +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for routes between your own cities. Additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for domestic trade routes as you progress through the Technology and Civic trees. Roads built in your territory are one level more advanced than usual.
+10 Defense against ranged attacks.

A district unique to Russia for religious activity. Replaces the Holy Site district and is cheaper to build.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Accrues [ICON_GREATWRITER] Great Writer, [ICON_GREATArtist] Great Artist, and [ICON_GREATMusician] Great Musician Points in cities with a Theater Square. Your city border grows by one tile each time a Great Person is expended in this city.
+100% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to Aqueducts. Holy Sites provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, and +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing if placed on a river. Holy Sites trigger a Culture Bomb.

Improvement that unlocks with Masonry and must be built on Desert, Desert Hills, Floodplains, Plains, or Grassland. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. Receives additional yields from adjacent districts. +2 [ICON_Food] Food if adjacent to a city center. For all other districts that award adjacency bonuses: +2 of the appropriate yield if that district is adjacent.

Earn 3 extra influence points per turn towards gaining envoys and pay half the usual cost to levy city-state units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When you capture a Barbarian Outpost, receive a Tribal Village reward in addition to the usual [ICON_Gold] Gold.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Ziggurat, unique to Sumeria.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Science] Science. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if next to River. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture at Diplomatic Service. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science at The Enlightenment. Cannot be built on Hills.

+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity from entertainment for each Lake tile within one tile of Huey Teocalli. +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each Lake tile in your empire. Must be built on a Lake tile adjacent to land.
+5 Combat from Fascism
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from the Fascism government.
+7 [ICON_Bombard] Bombard Strength when attacking land units.
+10 [ICON_Bombard] Bombard Strength when attacking land units.
+10 [ICON_Bombard] Bombard Strength when attacking naval units.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking melee and ranged units.

City Centers gain +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_FOOD] for every adjacent Desert and Desert Hills tiles. Mines receive -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Additional +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold on Mines after researching Banking and also Economics. May purchase Commercial Hub district buildings with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Faster movement in Woods and Rainforest terrain.
Cree unique Ancient era unit that is stronger than and replaces the Scout. Faster [ICON_Movement] Movement in Woods and Rainforest terrain.

Grants an extra belief when founding a Religion. Settlers and Builders receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement. +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each civilization (including India) they have met that has founded a Religion and is not currently at war. Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against Gandhi.

Leveraging City States costs half [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE]City State units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if you are the City State's Suzerain (including Leveraged Units).[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title. +2 envoys and +2 influence per turn towards envoys.

+1 [ICON_Production] Production from the Lumber Mill improvement. Unlocks Urban Defenses, giving all of your cities an automatic 300 Fortification Strength and the ability to perform a ranged attack. All previous wall improvements become obsolete and siege support units are no longer effective.

+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food in Tundra tiles. In Snow and Tundra tiles, all Mines and Lumbermills provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, all Camps provides +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and strategic resource accumulation rate is +100%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can build Farms on Tundra tiles, and also on Tundra Hills tiles with the Civil Engineering Civic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The cost of purchasing Snow, Snow Hills, Tundra Hills and Tundra tiles is reduced by 50%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cities with National Parks generate an extra +8 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +8 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production per turn.
Receive 25% of a military land unit's production value in [ICON_FAITH] Faith when produced.
Receive 25% of a military land unit's production value in [ICON_FAITH] Faith when produced.
When chosen, receive a Builder in your capital. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE], [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP], [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE], and [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] tiles.
When chosen receive a Builder in your capital. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE], [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP], [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE], and [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] tiles.
You successfully land a person on the moon! Grants a [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus equal to 5 times your [ICON_Science] Science per turn, and marks the second step towards the Science Victory.

Space Race project which launches a large rocket to land a human on the moon. Grants a [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus equal to 5 times your [ICON_Science] Science per turn, and marks the second step towards the Science Victory.
50% resource discount on all unit production and upgrades.
50% [ICON_Gold] Gold discount on all unit upgrades. 50% resource discount on all unit production and upgrades.

+1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point per turn after researching Astrology. The last available [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet will automatically go to Arabia, if they have not already recruited one. +1 [ICON_Science] Science for each foreign city following Arabia's Religion.
+25% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and wonders if placed next to a River. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food on floodplains tiles and floodplains do not block placement of districts and wonders.
+25% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and wonders if placed next to a River. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food on floodplains tiles. Does not receive damage from Floods.
All world wonders provide +6 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Allows construction of Dar-e Mehrs (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture).
Shrines and Temples provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production equal to their intrinsic [ICON_Faith] Faith output.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production from Marsh, Oasis, and Floodplains.
Holy Site districts get +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith from adjacent Rainforest and Woods tiles.

Hungarian unique Medieval Era unit that replaces the Courser. +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each adjacent Levied unit.

Levied units gain an ability giving them +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. It cost 75% less [ICON_GOLD] Gold and resources to upgrade Levied units. If you Levy troops from a City-State, receive 1 [ICON_ENVOY] Envoy with that City-State. Gain the Black Army unique unit when the Castles technology is researched.

Adjacency: +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for every 2 adjacent mines. -1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for each adjacent District except for Theater Squares. Also provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for adjacent Theater Squares.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Units heal completely if they heal for one turn adjacent to the Dead Sea.
+{1_Amount} Combat Strength when within 4 tiles of a National Park
+{1_Amount} Combat Strength when within 4 tiles of an Owned National Park

A building unique to Georgia which replaces and is stronger than the Ancient Walls. Provides +3 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after advancing to the Conservation Civic. Provides +4 [ICON_Faith] Faith. When in a Golden Age the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism and [ICON_FAITH] Faith are +100%.

+25% [ICON_Production] Production towards all naval and land military units. Reduces the maintenance cost of units by 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title and increases Strategic Resources stockpiles by 15.
Three tile natural wonder. It provides +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +4 [ICON_Production] Production.
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +6 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food, +3 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Science] Science.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles.
All land combat and religious units receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.

+100% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to Theater Square Buildings. Great Works in Eleanorâ€™s cities each cause -1 Loyalty per turn in foreign cities within 9 tiles. A city that leaves another civilization due to a loss of Loyalty and is currently receiving the most Loyalty per turn from Eleanor's civilization skips the Free City step to join this civilization.
+100% [ICON_Production] Production toward Siege units and walls.
A district unique to Korea that replaces the Campus district and must be built on hills. +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science base adjacency. Provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to adjacent Theater Squares.

Adjacency: +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for every 2 adjacent mines. -1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for each adjacent District except for Theater Squares. Also provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for adjacent Theater Squares.

Replace.Text: Mapuche unique Medieval Era unit that replaces the Courser. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement and pillaging only costs 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
Modern era anti-air support unit. Provides cover from air attacks up to 1 hex away from the weapon.
Hungarian unique Industrial era unit that replaces Cavalry. +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for every active Alliance.

Canadian unique Modern era unit. Can create a National Park. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting within 4 tiles of a National Park. Additional +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting within 4 tiles of an Owned National Park.
Grants the ability to construct an additional Spy. +50% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire.
+50% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire.

Space Race project which launches a large rocket to land a human on the moon. Grants a one time [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus equal to 5 times your [ICON_Science] Science per turn, and marks the second step towards the Science Victory.

All naval melee units get +25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and can raid the coast. Receive [ICON_SCIENCE] Science from pillaging and coastal raiding Mines in addition to [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Pillaging or coastal raiding Quarries, Pastures, Plantations, and Camps provide [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in addition to [ICON_FAITH] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All Holy Site districts and their buildings get +50% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Holy Sites get standard adjacency bonus from coastal water tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Harbors next to a Holy Site get an additional +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold adjacency bonus.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct the Great Wall, unique to China.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides an increase to [ICON_Strength] Defense and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture after researching Castles. +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if there is an adjacent Great Wall Improvement. Provides [ICON_Tourism] Tourism after researching Flight. Must be built in a line along the borders of your empire. Can only be pillaged (never destroyed) by natural disasters.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Mission, unique to Spain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food if on a different continent than your [ICON_Capital] Capital.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Science] Science for every adjacent Campus and Holy Site district. +1 Housing at Civil Service and +2 Science at The Enlightenment.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Chateau, unique to France.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 Appeal. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for each adjacent Wonder. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Luxury resource. Provides +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing at Feudalism and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight. Can only be built adjacent to Rivers.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Chateau, unique to France.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 Appeal. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for each adjacent wonder. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Luxury resource. Provides +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing at Feudalism and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight. Can only be built adjacent to Rivers.

Grants an extra belief when founding a Religion. Settlers and Builders receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement. +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn for each civilization (including India) they have met that has founded a Religion and is not currently at war. Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against Gandhi.

May form Fleets and Armadas earlier than usual (Mercenaries and Mercantilism). [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between multiple continents receive bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold for routes to other civilizations, and bonus [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production for routes between your own cities. +2 Loyalty per turn for cities with a Mission improvement adjacent to the City Center and not on your original [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.

30% [ICON_FAITH] Faith discount on Missionaries. Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time and eliminate 100% of the presence of other Religions. Combat units have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.

All naval melee units get +25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and can raid the coast.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All Holy Site districts and their buildings get +50% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Holy Sites get standard adjacency bonus from coastal water tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Harbors next to a Holy Site get an additional +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold adjacency bonus.

Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology. Naval melee units heal in neutral territory. Units ignore additional [ICON_Movement] Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.
Norwegian unique Medieval era unit. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement if this unit starts in enemy territory or is embarked. +15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.

Replace.Text: Receive boosts upon city conquest: +20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] in all cities for 10 turns, as well as a [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for each Encampment or Campus in the conquered city and an [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration for each Holy Site or Theater Square.

Receive boosts upon city conquest: +20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] in all cities for 10 turns, as well as a [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for each Encampment or Campus in the conquered city and an [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration for each Holy Site or Theater Square.

Macedonian unique heavy cavalry unit. Additional +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when adjacent to a [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General from any era. +5 [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General points when killing an enemy unit. Starts with 1 free Promotion.

All Mongolian units double the usual [ICON_Strength] Combat Bonus for having a higher level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility than their opponent. Starting a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route immediately creates a [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Post in the destination city.
Egyptian unique Ancient era ranged unit. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement when starting in open terrain.
God of War and Plunder
+1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point from Encampment (General), Harbor (Admiral), and Commerical Hub (Merchant) districts.

American unique Industrial era unit that replaces Cavalry. [ICON_Culture] Culture is earned from kills on their [ICON_Capital] Capital`s continent. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hills. Lower maintenance cost.

Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. +1 Appeal to all tiles in a city with a National Park. Gain the Rough Rider unique unit when they research the Military Science technology.

The worship building for their Religion can be purchased by any player for just one-tenth of the usual [ICON_Faith] Faith cost. It adds 20% to the [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith, and [ICON_Culture] Culture to the city's output.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production for 10 turns after liberating a city.
A building unique to the Aztecs. Provides an [ICON_Amenities] Amenity, +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and a [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General Point.
Chinese unique unit that replaces the Crossbowman. +7 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength when attacking adjacent enemy units.

Georgian unique Classical Era unit that replaces the Swordsman. Hills provide a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus and only require 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.

Killing a unit provides [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to 50% of the defeated unit's base [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength. Each [ICON_ENVOY] Envoy you send to a city-state of your majority Religion counts as two [ICON_ENVOY] Envoys. (Must have a majority Religion).
After unlocking the Guilds civic, each city can build one more district than usual (exceeding the normal limit based on [ICON_Citizen] Population).

Cannot be built on Hills or adjacent to another Stepwell.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district. Commercial Hubs do not receive bonuses from adjacent rivers.

A building unique to Khmer that replace the Temple. Grants a free Missionary when built (if a Religion has been founded). Missionaries purchased in this city receive the Martyr ability, which grants a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic if this Missionary dies in Theological Combat. Required to purchase Apostles and Inquisitors with [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Russian unique Industrial era unit that replaces Cavalry. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or adjacent to its home territory. Can move after attacking if [ICON_Movement] Movement points remain.

Scythian unique Classical Era ranged unit with 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement and a [ICON_Range] Range of 2.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Mission, unique to Spain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith if on a different continent than your [ICON_Capital] Capital.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Science] Science if built next to a Campus district. +1 Housing at Civil Service.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 Science at The Enlightenment.
May form Corps (Mercenaries Civic) and Armies (Nationalism Civic) earlier. An additional +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Base Combat Strength to both Corps and Armies at Mobilization Civic.

Pen, Brush, and Voice Golden Age:[NEWLINE][ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide an additional 10% of civic costs. Each city receives +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each specialty district.

Pen, Brush, and Voice: Gain +1 Era Score each time you trigger an [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration. +1 Era Score for constructing a building with a Great Work Slot. If chosen at the start of a Golden Age, [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide an additional 10% of civic costs. Each city receives +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each specialty district.
+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Quarries.
+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Mines over Luxury and Bonus resources.
Combat units gain +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength near foreign cities that follow this Religion.
Each Holy Site or Theater Square district in a city following this Religion provides +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith or +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture respectively.
Religion spreads to cities 40% further away.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science for every 3 followers of this Religion in other civilizations.
+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity in cities with a specialty district.
Holy Site Districts, Shrines, and Temples each provide +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every 3 followers of this Religion.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every 3 followers of this Religion in other civilizations.
+15% [ICON_Production] Production towards wonders.
+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every foreign city following this Religion.
+1 [ICON_ENVOY] Envoy when you build a wonder, including Apadana, in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built adjacent to your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.

Grants a free [ICON_GREATADMIRAL] Great Admiral when the wonder is constructed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All [ICON_GREATADMIRAL] Great Admirals and all [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great Generals can use their retirement ability an additional time. Must be built adjacent to a Harbor district.
+100% [ICON_Production] Production towards naval units in all cities. Must be built on a Coast tile that is adjacent to an Industrial Zone district.

Increases growth by 15% in all cities. +2 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing in the city in which this wonder is built and +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing in all other cities within 6 tiles. Must be built next to a river.
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +2 [ICON_Science] Science.
Three tile natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears with Cliffs adjacent to water and provides +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
One tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_Science] Science, +4 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It appears on coastal terrain and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food to adjacent tiles.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct Fishing Boats.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Can only be built on valid resources.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If built on Luxury resources, the city will gain use of that resource.
